messages.content:
Here's a learning strategy:
 **Visualize the Information**

Create a mind map or a diagram to visualize the information in the document. This will help you to see the relationships between the different pieces of information, such as the candidates, parties, and election results.



Apply this strategy to the following document:
<document>

1985 St. Louis mayoral election
| map_image = 
| turnout = 16.24%
{{ElectionsMO}}
| percentage2 = 14.88%
| previous_year = 1981
| before_election    = [[Vincent C. Schoemehl]]
| after_party        = Democratic Party (United States)
{{Infobox election
| popular_vote2 = 10,937
<!-- "none" is preferred when the title is sufficiently descriptive; see [[WP:SDNONE]] -->
| map_size = 200px
}}
| candidate2 = Curtis Crawford
| election_name = 1985 St. Louis mayoral election
| ongoing = No
| election_date = April 2, 1985
{{Use mdy dates|date=December 2019}}
| previous_election = 1981 St. Louis mayoral election
| title              = Mayor
| next_year = 1989
| party2 = Republican Party (United States)
| before_party       = Democratic Party (United States)
| flag_image = Flag of St. Louis, Missouri.svg
{{Short description|none}}
| candidate1 = '''[[Vincent C. Schoemehl]]'''
| next_election = 1989 St. Louis mayoral election
| after_election     = [[Vincent C. Schoemehl]]
{{Use American English|date=January 2025}}
| percentage1 = '''85.12%'''
| party1 = Democratic Party (United States)
| popular_vote1 = '''62,583'''

</document>

Here's a learning strategy:
 **Break Down the Information into Categories**

Divide the information into categories, such as:

* Election Details (date, turnout, etc.)
* Candidates (Vincent C. Schoemehl, Curtis Crawford)
* Parties (Democratic Party, Republican Party)
* Election Results (popular vote, percentage, etc.)

This will help you to organize the information and make it easier to review.



Apply this strategy to the following document:
<document>

1985 St. Louis mayoral election
| map_image = 
| turnout = 16.24%
{{ElectionsMO}}
| percentage2 = 14.88%
| previous_year = 1981
| before_election    = [[Vincent C. Schoemehl]]
| after_party        = Democratic Party (United States)
{{Infobox election
| popular_vote2 = 10,937
<!-- "none" is preferred when the title is sufficiently descriptive; see [[WP:SDNONE]] -->
| map_size = 200px
}}
| candidate2 = Curtis Crawford
| election_name = 1985 St. Louis mayoral election
| ongoing = No
| election_date = April 2, 1985
{{Use mdy dates|date=December 2019}}
| previous_election = 1981 St. Louis mayoral election
| title              = Mayor
| next_year = 1989
| party2 = Republican Party (United States)
| before_party       = Democratic Party (United States)
| flag_image = Flag of St. Louis, Missouri.svg
{{Short description|none}}
| candidate1 = '''[[Vincent C. Schoemehl]]'''
| next_election = 1989 St. Louis mayoral election
| after_election     = [[Vincent C. Schoemehl]]
{{Use American English|date=January 2025}}
| percentage1 = '''85.12%'''
| party1 = Democratic Party (United States)
| popular_vote1 = '''62,583'''

</document>

Here's a learning strategy:
 **Use Mnemonics**

Create mnemonics to help you remember key pieces of information, such as the percentage of the vote that Vincent C. Schoemehl won (85.12%) or the number of votes he received (62,583).



Apply this strategy to the following document:
<document>

1985 St. Louis mayoral election
| map_image = 
| turnout = 16.24%
{{ElectionsMO}}
| percentage2 = 14.88%

}}

</document>

Here's a learning strategy:
 **Create a Timeline**

Create a timeline of the election, including the dates of the election and previous and next elections. This will help you to see the sequence of events and understand the context of the election.

 **Focus on Key Information**

Identify the most important information in the document, such as the election results and the candidates, and focus on those first. This will help you to prioritize the information and ensure that you understand the main points.

 **Use Flashcards**

Here's a learning strategy:
 **Practice Active Recall**

Test yourself on the information by trying to recall key pieces of information without looking at the document. This will help you to identify areas where you need more practice and reinforce your understanding of the material.

Here's a learning strategy:
 Look for Patterns or Connections
Look for patterns or connections between different pieces of information. For example, you might notice that the same party has been in power for multiple elections or that certain candidates have run in multiple elections.

 8. **Teach Someone Else**
Teach the information to someone else. This will help you retain the information and identify any areas where you need more practice.

Here's a learning strategy:
 **Get Enough Sleep**: Get enough sleep and take breaks to help your brain consolidate the information and retain it better.



Apply this strategy to the following document:
<document>

Maryam Mirzakhani
Maryam Mirzakhani
'''Maryam Mirzakhani''' ({{langx|fa|مریم میرزاخانی}}, {{IPA|fa|mæɾˈjæm miːɾzɑːxɑːˈniː|pron}}; 12 May 1977&nbsp;– 14 July 2017) was an Iranian<ref name="mmcv2" /><ref name="bio"></ref> mathematician and a professor of mathematics at [[Stanford University]].<ref name="Weil-Petersson">{{Cite journal | first1 = Maryam | last1 = Mirzakhani | year = 2007 | journal = [[Journal of the American Mathematical Society]] | title = Weil-Petersson volumes and intersection theory on the moduli space of curves | doi = 10.1090/S0894-0347-06-00526-1 | volume = 20 | issue = 1 | mr = 2257394 | pages = 1–23 | url = https://www.ams.org/journals/jams/2007-20-01/S0894-0347-06-00526-1/S0894-0347-06-00526-1.pdf | bibcode = 2007JAMS...20....1M | access-date = 2 September 2015 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20160304080300/http://www.ams.org/journals/jams/2007-20-01/S0894-0347-06-00526-1/S0894-0347-06-00526-1.pdf | archive-date = 4 March 2016 | url-status = live | doi-access = free }}</ref><ref>{{Cite journal | journal = [[Inventiones Mathematicae]] | first1= Maryam|last1= Mirzakhani | title = Simple geodesics and Weil-Petersson volumes of moduli spaces of bordered Riemann surfaces | date= January 2007 |volume=167 |issue=1 |pages=179–222 | doi = 10.1007/s00222-006-0013-2 |issn=1432-1297 |bibcode=2006InMat.167..179M | s2cid= 44008647}}</ref> Her research topics included [[Teichmüller space|Teichmüller theory]], [[hyperbolic geometry]], [[ergodic theory]], and [[symplectic geometry]].<ref name="mmcv2"></ref> On 13 August 2014, Mirzakhani was honored with the [[Fields Medal]], the most prestigious award in mathematics,<ref name="Farsnews">{{cite news |date=14 August 2014 |title=President Rouhani Congratulates Iranian Woman for Winning Math Nobel Prize |publisher=[[Fars News Agency]] |url=http://english.farsnews.ir/newstext.aspx?nn=13930523000321 |url-status=dead |access-date=14 August 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140814194229/http://english.farsnews.com/newstext.aspx?nn=13930523000321 |archive-date=14 August 2014}}</ref><ref name="IMU2014">{{cite web |title=IMU Prizes 2014 |url=http://www.mathunion.org/general/prizes/2014 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140812205734/http://www.mathunion.org/general/prizes/2014/ |archive-date=12 August 2014 |access-date=12 August 2014 |publisher=International Mathematical Union}}</ref> becoming the first woman to win the prize, as well as the first Iranian.<ref name="Dehghan">{{cite news |first=Saeed Kamali |last=Dehghan |date=16 July 2017 |title=Maryam Mirzakhani: Iranian newspapers break hijab taboo in tributes |language=en-GB |newspaper=The Guardian |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/jul/16/maryam-mirzakhani-iranian-newspapers-break-hijab-taboo-in-tributes#img-2 |url-status=live |access-date=18 July 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170718033745/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/jul/16/maryam-mirzakhani-iranian-newspapers-break-hijab-taboo-in-tributes#img-2 |archive-date=18 July 2017 |issn=0261-3077}}</ref> The award committee cited her work in "the dynamics and geometry of [[Riemann surface]]s and their [[moduli space]]s".<ref name="sample">{{cite news |last=Sample |first=Ian |date=13 August 2014 |title=Fields Medal mathematics prize won by woman for first time in its history |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |url=https://www.theguardian.com/science/2014/aug/13/fields-medal-mathematics-prize-woman-maryam-mirzakhani |url-status=live |access-date=9 June 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160608173407/https://www.theguardian.com/science/2014/aug/13/fields-medal-mathematics-prize-woman-maryam-mirzakhani |archive-date=8 June 2016}}</ref> Mirzakhani was considered a leading force in the fields of hyperbolic geometry, [[topology]] and dynamics.<ref name=":1" />
Maryam Mirzakhani

</document>

Here's a learning strategy:
 **Stay Motivated**: Stay motivated and engaged with the material by setting goals and rewarding yourself for progress.

free }}</ref><ref>{{Cite journal | journal = [[Inventiones Mathematicae]] | first1= Maryam|last1= Mirzakhani | title = Simple geodesics and Weil-Petersson volumes of moduli spaces of bordered Riemann |first=Saeed Kamali |last=Dehghan |date=16 July 2017 |title=Maryam Mirzakhani: Iranian newspapers break hijab taboo in tributes |language=en-GB |newspaper=The Guardian |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/jul/16/maryam-mirzakhani-iranian-newspapers-break-hijab-taboo-in-tributes#img-2 |url-status=live |access-date=18 July 2017 2017 |issn=0261-3077}}</ref> The award committee cited her work in "the dynamics and geometry of [[Riemann surface]]s and their [[moduli space]]s".<ref name="sample">{{cite news |last=Sample |first=Ian |date=13 August 2014 |title=Fields Medal mathematics prize won by woman for first time in its history |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |url=https://www.theguardian.com/science/2014/aug/13/fields-medal-mathematics-prize-woman-maryam-mirzakhani |url-status=live |access-date=9 June 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160608173407/https://www.theguardian.com/science/2014/aug/13/fields-medal-mathematics-prize-woman-maryam-mirzakhani |archive-date=8 June 2016}}</ref> Here's a learning strategy:
 Use Mnemonics
Create a mnemonic device to remember the engine size (577 cc) or other key details. For example, you could create a sentence or phrase using the first letter of each key detail.



Apply this strategy to the following document:
<document>

Mazda R360
Mazda R360
[[Category:Microcars]]
}}{{clear}}
[[Category:Cars introduced in 1960]]

Here's a learning strategy:
 **4. Use visual aids**

Create diagrams or maps to illustrate the layout of the zoo and the different exhibits. This can help to visualize the information and make it easier to remember.



Apply this strategy to the following document:
<document>

Valencia Bioparc
Valencia Bioparc
Valencia Bioparc
Valencia Bioparc
Valencia Bioparc
Located in Valencia's Turia riverbed, most of the animals moved to the new Bioparc facilities from the old city's zoo when the park opened in 2008.<ref name="Unknown author 4"></ref>The concept of the zoo, called ''[[Immersion exhibit|Zooimersion]]'' in Spanish, consists of immersing visitors into the animals' habitat and not vice versa. This is achieved by not using the traditional railings and cages that are common in many zoos, using instead rivers, ponds, streams and rocks to separate  visitors from the animals.<ref name="Velert" /> Also, great care has been taken in reproducing the eco-systems, including an important collection of African flora.<ref name="Unknown Author" /><ref name="Velert"></ref><ref name="Unknown 3"></ref>The zoo is the birthplace of [[Makena (elephant)|Makena]], the first elephant born in the [[Valencian Community]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=NTC |first=À Punt |date=2022-11-09 |title=Naix el primer elefant “valencià” del Bioparc |url=https://www.apuntmedia.es/noticies/societat/naix-elefant-valencia-bioparc_1_1560542.html |access-date=2023-06-15 |website=À Punt |language=ca}}</ref>
Valencia Bioparc
Valencia Bioparc
Valencia Bioparc
Valencia Bioparc
Valencia Bioparc

</document>

Here's a learning strategy:
 9. **Review and practice regularly**
Review the document regularly and practice recalling the information to help solidify it in your long-term memory.



Apply this strategy to the following document:
<document>

Maryam Mirzakhani
Maryam Mirzakhani
Maryam Mirzakhani
Maryam Mirzakhani
Mirzakhani was born on 12 May 1977<ref name="may12"></ref><ref name="mactutor"></ref> in [[Tehran]], Iran.<ref></ref> As a child, she attended [[Tehran Farzanegan School]], part of the [[National Organization for Development of Exceptional Talents]] (NODET). In her junior and senior years of high school, she won the gold medal for mathematics in the Iranian National Olympiad, thus allowing her to bypass the national college entrance exam.<ref name="ریاضی به درست فکرکردن کمک می‌کند">{{cite news |title=ریاضی به درست فکرکردن کمک می‌کند |url=https://donya-e-eqtesad.com/بخش-ویژه-نامه-63/3266185-ریاضی-به-درست-فکرکردن-کمک-می-کند |access-date=2 December 2018 |work=Donya-e-Eghtesaad |date=21 August 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190402162828/https://donya-e-eqtesad.com/بخش-ویژه-نامه-63/3266185-ریاضی-به-درست-فکرکردن-کمک-می-کند |archive-date=2 April 2019 |url-status=live }}</ref> In 1994, Mirzakhani became the first Iranian woman to win a gold medal at the [[International Mathematical Olympiad]] in [[British Hong Kong|Hong Kong]], scoring 41 out of 42 points.<ref></ref> The following year, in [[Toronto]], she became the first Iranian to achieve the full score and to win two gold medals in the International Mathematical Olympiad.<ref name=olympiad>{{IMO results|id=926}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.newscientist.com/article/dn26044-iranian-woman-wins-maths-top-prize-the-fields-medal.html |title=Iranian woman wins maths' top prize |work=New Scientist |date=12 August 2014 |access-date=13 August 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140813071853/http://www.newscientist.com/article/dn26044-iranian-woman-wins-maths-top-prize-the-fields-medal.html |archive-date=13 August 2014 |url-status=live }}</ref> Later in her life, she collaborated with friend, colleague, and Olympiad silver medalist, Roya Beheshti Zavareh ({{langx|fa|رؤیا بهشتی زواره}}), on their book ''Elementary Number Theory, Challenging Problems'', (in [[Persian language|Persian]]) which was published in 1999.<ref name="ریاضی به درست فکرکردن کمک می‌کند"/> Mirzakhani and Zavareh together were the first women to compete in the Iranian National Mathematical Olympiad and won gold and silver medals in 1995, respectively.
Maryam Mirzakhani
Maryam Mirzakhani
Maryam Mirzakhani
== Early life and education ==
Maryam Mirzakhani

</document>
